title: Refine evasive “No” button behavior: proximity-triggered smooth slide within button area

requirements.text: Update the evasive “No” button behavior so it only moves within the limited area around the Yes/No buttons (not the full card or screen).

quotes: 1. only within the area around the buttons

acceptanceCriteria: When the “No” button moves, its translated position always remains inside a clearly bounded region surrounding the Yes/No buttons (with a small padding), and never roams elsewhere in the layout.
The “No” button never becomes partially clipped by the bounded region (i.e., it stays fully visible).

requirements.text: Change the evasive trigger so the “No” button moves only when the cursor approaches it (proximity-based), rather than moving immediately on hover/enter.

quotes: 2. movement only when the cursor approaches

acceptanceCriteria: Moving the mouse around the page does not cause the “No” button to move unless the pointer is within a defined proximity threshold of the “No” button.
Approaching the “No” button reliably triggers a dodge movement before the pointer reaches the button.
Touch behavior continues to dodge on touch interaction (or equivalent), without requiring precise hovering.

requirements.text: Remove the sudden/bouncy movement and make the “No” button slide away smoothly to its new safe position; also ensure it never gets hidden under/behind the “Yes” button during or after movement.

quotes: remove the sudden bounce and just make it move around playfully, make sure it dosn't get hidden under the yes button

acceptanceCriteria: The movement animation uses a smooth slide (no overshoot/bounce effect) when transitioning between positions.
During movement, the “No” button never appears behind the “Yes” button (stacking order and/or overlap avoidance prevents hiding).
If a randomly chosen target position would overlap the “Yes” button area, a different target position is chosen so the “No” button remains clearly visible and readable.

constraints: Frontend changes must not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the current single-page Valentine layout and existing Yes/No interaction structure; only refine the No button’s evasive behavior per the user’s constraints.
nonGoals: Adding new pages, routes, or backend APIs.
Changing the existing Valentine theme, copy, or the “Yes” flow beyond what’s required to adjust the “No” button behavior.
Implementing continuous autonomous drifting of the “No” button (movement must be proximity-triggered).

preferencesToAdd: Use English for any user-facing text in build requests.
